dt: {bc}the right or license granted to an individual or group to market a company's goods or services in a particular territory
{bc}a business granted such a right or license

dt.t: just opened a new fast-food {wi}franchise{/wi} down the street

dt: {bc}the territory involved in such a right
{bc}a constitutional or statutory right or privilege
{bc}a special privilege granted to an individual or group
{bc}the right to be and exercise the powers of a corporation
{bc}the right of membership in a professional sports league
{bc}a team and its operating organization having such membership

dt.t: He's the best player in the history of the {wi}franchise{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a series of related works (such as novels or films) each of which includes the same characters or different characters that are understood to exist and interact in the same fictional universe with characters from the other works

dt.t: The main reason we all keep going back to the {ldquo}Mission: Impossible{rdquo} {wi}franchise{/wi} is the stunts, of course. Watching Ethan Hunt as he scales mountains, jumps onto planes and dangles from skyscrapers fills us with eye-rolling delight.
Rowling's seven Harry Potter novels sold more than 500 million copies. Its respective film {wi}franchise{/wi} drummed up over $7 billion at the box office.

dt: {bc}freedom or immunity from some burden or restriction vested in a person or group

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from {it}franchir{/it} to free, from {it}franc{/it} free {ma}{mat|frank|}{/ma}
shortdef: the right or license granted to an individual or group to market a company's goods or services in a particular territory; also : a business granted such a right or license
the territory involved in such a right
a constitutional or statutory right or privilege; especially : the right to vote
